verses.verse: To the chief Musician<WH5329>, Maschil<WH4905>, for the sons<WH1121> of Korah<WH7141>. As the hart<WH354> panteth<WH6165> after the water<WH4325> brooks<WH650>, so panteth<WH6165> my soul<WH5315> after thee, O God<WH430>.
My soul<WH5315> thirsteth<WH6770> for God<WH430>, for the living<WH2416> God<WH410>: when shall I come<WH935> and appear<WH7200> before<WH6440> God<WH430>?
My tears<WH1832> have been my meat<WH3899> day<WH3119> and night<WH3915>, while they continually<WH3117> say<WH559> unto me, Where is thy God<WH430>?

When I remember<WH2142> these things, I pour out<WH8210> my soul<WH5315> in me: for I had gone<WH5674> with the multitude<WH5519>, I went<WH1718> with them to the house<WH1004> of God<WH430>, with the voice<WH6963> of joy<WH7440> and praise<WH8426>, with a multitude<WH1995> that kept holyday<WH2287>.

Why art thou cast down<WH7817>, O my soul<WH5315>? and why art thou disquieted<WH1993> in me? hope<WH3176> thou in God<WH430>: for I shall yet praise<WH3034> him for the help<WH3444> of his countenance<WH6440>.

O my God<WH430>, my soul<WH5315> is cast down<WH7817> within me: therefore will I remember<WH2142> thee from the land<WH776> of Jordan<WH3383>, and of the Hermonites<WH2769>, from the hill<WH2022> Mizar<WH4706>.
Deep<WH8415> calleth<WH7121> unto deep<WH8415> at the noise<WH6963> of thy waterspouts<WH6794>: all thy waves<WH4867> and thy billows<WH1530> are gone<WH5674> over me.

Yet the LORD<WH3068> will command<WH6680> his lovingkindness<WH2617> in the daytime<WH3119>, and in the night<WH3915> his song<WH7892> shall be with me, and my prayer<WH8605> unto the God<WH410> of my life<WH2416>.
I will say<WH559> unto God<WH410> my rock<WH5553>, Why hast thou forgotten<WH7911> me? why go<WH3212> I mourning<WH6937> because of the oppression<WH3906> of the enemy<WH341>?
As with a sword<WH7524> in my bones<WH6106>, mine enemies<WH6887> reproach<WH2778> me; while they say<WH559> daily<WH3117> unto me, Where is thy God<WH430>?

Why art thou cast down<WH7817>, O my soul<WH5315>? and why art thou disquieted<WH1993> within me? hope<WH3176> thou in God<WH430>: for I shall yet praise<WH3034> him, who is the health<WH3444> of my countenance<WH6440>, and my God<WH430>.
